thread.title: UEFA open disciplinary proceedings against St Etienne after flares were set off at Old Trafford
thread.title_full: UEFA open disciplinary proceedings against St Etienne after flares were set off at Old Trafford

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: UEFA open disciplinary proceedings against St Etienne after flares were set off at Old Trafford
text:
UEFA open disciplinary proceedings against St Etienne after flares were set off at Old Trafford Frustrated Manchester United fans have blasted Old Trafford security following the raucous display Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now St Etienne fans set off flares inside Old Trafford Share this video Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
UEFA have opened disciplinary proceedings against AS St Etienne after flares were set off at Old Trafford. 
Fans of the French side were seen lighting the fireworks and throwing objects during St Etienne’s Europa League Clash with Manchester United on Thursday night. 
A statement from UEFA said: “Disciplinary proceedings have been opened against AS Saint-Étienne due to the behaviour of their supporters during their UEFA Europa League Round of 32 match against Manchester United FC on 16 February 2017 at Old Trafford . 
“The following proceedings have been opened against AS Saint-Étienne for the subsequent infringements: setting off of firework, throwing of objects and improper conduct of supporters. Flares in the stands at Old Trafford (Photo: PA) 
“The UEFA Control, Ethics and Disciplinary Board will meet to deal with this case at its meeting on March 23, 2017.” 
Video footage filmed by fans shows the stadium engulfed with red and green smoke after fans ignited the flares. 
The Ligue 1 side could now face a hefty punishment from UEFA following the breach. Read More 
Despite the disruption, Greater Manchester Police last night said the game passed “without major incident” and only two people were arrested on Thursday night. In pictures: St Etienne let off flares at Old Trafford View gallery 
Frustrated reds fans have also blasted the security at Old Trafford and said it was lucky nobody was injured. 
Life-long Manchester United fan Keith Bradley, 53, of Worsley, said: “I am absolutely livid over what happened last night. 
“There is heightened security at the moment at United. If you turn up you get searched at the door, you walk up to the turnstile, you get searched. 
“But then you see in the ground at least 20 to 30 flares going off last night. What really narked me is in this day and age the way things are going on, if anybody sees that and wants to do something at Old Trafford they might think it would be easier to get in something bigger than a flare. St Etienne fans set off flares at Old Trafford (Photo: Getty/ Manchester United) 
“There were so many kids and women there last night. How did all of those flares get into the stadium?” 
Sean Leeming, who attended the game, said: “It was incredible. I just can’t believe that every United fan got searched so thoroughly, yet they were able to get through the gates with dozens of flares and then set them off in the ground.” 
Manchester United have been contacted for a comment. Read More
